channel.title: Division and Additem

item.title: Division and Additem
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:6, topic:269505”][quote author=x blitz x link=topic=355673.msg2722519#msg2722519 date=1238094131]
Because you can’t divide a number by zero.
[/quote]

Oh can you not?[/quote]
Division by zero is an operation for which you cannot find an answer, so it is disallowed. You can understand why if you think about how division and multiplication are related.

12 divided by 6 is 2 because 6 times 2 is 12

12 divided by 0 is x would mean that
0 times x = 12


But no value would work for x because 0 times any number is 0. So division by zero doesn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Division and Additem
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:8, topic:269505”][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=355673.msg2722534#msg2722534 date=1238094734]

Because you can’t divide a number by zero.

Oh can you not?

Dividing by zero results in ‘undefined’.
[/quote]

Quoted from The Brahmasphutasiddhanta of Brahmagupta.

[quote]
A positive or negative number when divided by zero is a fraction with the zero as denominator. Zero divided by a negative or positive number is either zero or is expressed as a fraction with zero as numerator and the finite quantity as denominator. Zero divided by zero is zero.
[/quote][/quote]
I was only quoting my math teacher.

Read full topic

A positive or negative number when divided by zero is a fraction with the zero as denominator. Zero divided by a negative or positive number is either zero or is expressed as a fraction with zero as numerator and the finite quantity as denominator. Zero divided by zero is zero.

item.description:
@_Jayden1 wrote:

I would try this-

if (won >= 1) { int take = stake1+stake2; { addItem(995, take/won2); won2 = 0; }

Other than that, Looks fine…

item.title: Division and Additem
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“jcrane164, post:3, topic:269505”][quote author=noobie22 link=topic=355673.msg2722235#msg2722235 date=1238065267]
Well you’re going to have to make it so the other team doesn’t get it, so it’s like this:

[code]if (won >= 1) {
int take = stake1+stake2;

addItem(995, take/won2);
won2 = 1;

}[/code]

You have to make it so it declares that they win, and the other team lost.
[/quote]

i know i have it so when they win it adds it to the int[/quote]
Try doing this,

System.out.println("Test: " + (take / won2));
if(won2 != 0) {
    addItem(995, (take/won2));
}

Because you can’t divide a number by zero.

Read full topic

item.title: Division and Additem
item.dc:creator: @jcrane164 jcrane164
item.description:
@jcrane164 wrote:

Is there something wrong with this code because it compiles correctly but when i try to use it, it doesnt divide.

I have all my integers declared etc, i have the ints where they are suppose to be

For example the “won2” is declared and it add one each time they join a game so it adds up and if 5 ppl join a game its 5 and the stake1 and stake2 are for each team which means the stake1 is for team 1 and i want it to divide by how many ppl won so if 12 people won 12m on team1 then they should each get 1m thats the purpose im trying to get at so please help i hope i narrowed it down.

[code]if (won >= 1) {
int take = stake1+stake2;

addItem(995, take/won2);
won2 = 0;

}[/code]

Read full topic
